cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles SW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the Gulf of Mexico toward the southeast Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana (roughly Intracoastal City to the Mouth of the Pearl River)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch is in effect from Sabine Pass (near Beaumont) to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA, and for Mobile Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Intracoastal City, LA to Mouth of the Pearl River; Storm Surge Warning east of Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA to MS/AL border including Lake Borgne, Lake Pontchartrain, and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas eastward through Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: 30–40% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) late Sunday into Monday; low (≈11%) chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible in Sabine Lake/Sabine Pass including approaches to Beaumont.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 4–6 in of rain with localized higher amounts and flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; dangerous seas and rip currents that will disrupt vessel traffic and cargo operations.
